standard_metadata.standard_description: Add, subtract, multiply, and divide decimals to hundredths, using concrete models or drawings and strategies based on place value, properties of operations, and/or the relationship between addition and subtraction; relate the strategy to a written method and explain the reasoning used.

question.content: **Subtract.**   *You may use the models shown to help find the difference.*   $0.54-0.14=$

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equally-sized smaller squares to represent hundredths. 54 squares are shaded and 46 squares are not shaded.
A square divided into 100 equally-sized smaller squares to represent hundredths. 14 squares are shaded and 86 squares are not shaded.

hints.content: To subtract $\blueE{0.54}-\maroonD{0.14}$, we can  cross $\maroonD{0.14}$ off of the grid that shows $\blueE{0.54}$ to show subtraction.
[[☃ image 1]]  When we subtract $\maroonD{0.14}$ from $\blueE{0.54}$, we get $\blueE{40}$ hundredths.

images.alt: A square divided into 100 equally-sized smaller squares to represent hundredths. 54 of the squares are shaded. 14 of the shaded squares have been crossed out. 40 shaded squares remain without being crossed out. The other 46 squares are unshaded.

hints.content: We can change $\blueE{40}$ hundredths into tenths.  [[☃ image 1]]  $\blueE{40\text { hundredths}}$ is equal to $\blueE{4\text { tenths}}$:  $\blueE{0.40}=\blueE{0.4}$

images.alt:
A square divided into 10 equally-sized columns to show tenths. 4 columns are shaded and 6 columns
are not shaded.
